```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library("ggplot2")
```

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
weights <- read.csv("/Users/stangosliner/Documents/Yale/Thesis/Thesis_InitialHeights - End Weights.csv")

#boxplot(log(weights$Mass) ~ weights$Plant*weights$Location)

#WaterProp <- weights$Location == "WaterProp"
#rm(WaterProp)
#boxplot(log(Mass) ~ Plant*Trophic_Levels*Location)

#head(weights)


#?geom_boxplot

ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = Location), data = weights) + geom_boxplot()

ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = as.factor(Trophic_Levels)), data = weights) + geom_boxplot()+ ylim(0, 250) + ggtitle("Plant Type vs. Trophic Levels")

ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = Invasive), data = weights) + geom_boxplot() + ylim(0, 250) + ggtitle("Plant Type vs. Invasive Status")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
#Data by site

#WALLINGFORD
wallingford <- read.csv("/Users/stangosliner/Documents/Yale/Thesis/Test Data/WallingfordTest.csv")
#boxplot(Mass ~ Plant*Trophic_Levels, data = wallingford, cex.axis = 0.6)
ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = Trophic_Levels), data = wallingford) + geom_boxplot()+ ylim(0, 250) + ggtitle("Wallingford: Plant Type vs. Trophic Levels")

ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = Invasive), data = wallingford) + geom_boxplot() + ylim(0, 250) + ggtitle("Wallingford: Plant Type vs. Invasive Status")



#WATERPROP
waterprop <- read.csv("/Users/stangosliner/Documents/Yale/Thesis/Test Data/WaterPropTest.csv")
#boxplot(Mass ~ Plant*Trophic_Levels, data = waterprop)
ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = Trophic_Levels), data = waterprop) + geom_boxplot()+ ylim(0, 250) + ggtitle("Water Prop: Plant Type vs. Trophic Levels")

ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = Invasive), data = waterprop) + geom_boxplot() + ylim(0, 250) + ggtitle("Water Prop: Plant Type vs. Invasive Status")



#FLANDERS
flanders <- read.csv("/Users/stangosliner/Documents/Yale/Thesis/Test Data/FlandersTest.csv")
#boxplot(Mass ~ Plant*Trophic_Levels, data = flanders)
ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = Trophic_Levels), data = flanders) + geom_boxplot() + ylim(0, 250) + ggtitle("Flanders: Plant Type vs. Trophic Levels")

ggplot(aes(y = Mass, x = Plant, fill = Invasive), data = flanders) + geom_boxplot() + ylim(0, 250) + ggtitle("Flanders: Plant Type vs. Invasive Status")
```
